title: 104_s1620
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Dredge Disposal Act of 1996" and pertains to dredged material disposal facilities. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 is amended to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities for Federal navigation projects. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 now includes provisions for dredged material disposal facilities as a general navigation feature for cost sharing under this section. No federal funds are required for the operation and maintenance of a dredged material disposal facility for Federal navigation projects. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 allows funds from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund to be used for construction of harbors, with the Secretary determining when funds are no longer needed for maintenance costs. The federal share of operation and maintenance costs for projects is limited. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 limits operation and maintenance costs for projects to $25,000,000 per fiscal year. Eligible costs include constructing dredged material disposal facilities for Federal navigation projects. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 limits operation and maintenance costs for Federal navigation projects to $25,000,000 per fiscal year, including constructing dredged material disposal facilities. Additionally, the Act covers the Federal share of costs for environmental dredging and disposal facilities for contaminated sediments in Federal navigation channels. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 limits operation and maintenance costs for Federal navigation projects to $25,000,000 per fiscal year, including constructing dredged material disposal facilities. It also covers the Federal share of costs for environmental dredging and disposal facilities for contaminated sediments in Federal navigation channels. Preference is given to port areas where annual payments of harbor maintenance fees exceed Federal costs for environmental remediation to facilitate maritime commerce and navigation. The subsection addresses the issue of harbor maintenance fees exceeding Federal expenditures for eligible projects in port areas. It applies to the provision of a dredged material disposal facility or associated navigation project construction contracts. The subsection addresses harbor maintenance fees exceeding Federal expenditures for eligible projects in port areas, specifically focusing on dredged material disposal facilities or navigation project construction contracts. Cooperative agreements between the Secretary and non-Federal interests must be amended to comply with this subsection within 30 days of enactment. The subsection requires cooperative agreements for dredged material disposal facilities to be amended to comply with the new provisions within 30 days. Amendments must be applied prospectively and should not increase non-Federal costs for such facilities.
